Articles.Content:
Exactly as the title suggests, just made two planes in the sph now i can't open the load menu??

- - - Updated - - -

Can't even launch a plane.... wow. Click launch, the buttons in the top right are now greyed out and i am stuck in the sph.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-04-28T20:46:48Z" title="04/28/2015 08:46  PM" data-short="9 yr">April 28, 2015</time> by SmashBrown**

Can you provide more information on what you were doing? Usually the load menu does not load if there is a corrupted craft file in the SPH directory in that particular save. If the problem seems to stem from nowhere, try removing all the craft under <savename>/ships/SPH in your KSP/saves directory and try loading then.</savename>

[Exception]: IsolatedStorageException: Could not find a part of the path "D:\Steam\steamapps\common\Kerbal Space Program\saves\For Stuff!!!\Ships\SPH\Auto-Saved Ship.craft".

- - - Updated - - -

When trying to load^^
Hmmm. I hope you did not delete the SPH directory, but if you did you can recreate it inside the ships folder. Did the editor work after that Exception or did the editor just break?

Everything was greyed out i had to ctrl alt del the game

Deleted my saves and verified the game files (using steam) and it seams to be working, sat on the runway with my new toy now. Thanks buddy
Ok great! Glad to be of some help. ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)

> 
> Ok great! Glad to be of some help. ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)

I wanted to speak up since i also experienced this. 

The SPH directory never created from a fresh install of ksp 1.0. Upon creating the directory myself the problem was resolved.

again all you have to do (if you can not save space planes) is create the SPH folder under .../Kerbal Space Program/save/Tostito/Ships/ 

as the simple fix.
